description: Sample data for testing Apple Shortcuts integrations with Second Brain

payload.transcription: Meeting with Sarah tomorrow at 2 PM to discuss Q1 budget review. Need to prepare slides on cost optimization and resource allocation.
New feature idea for the app: implement dark mode with system preference sync. Users have been requesting this for months. Should be straightforward with CSS variables.

test_requests.name: Business Card
test_requests.note: Replace image_data with actual base64 encoded image

payload.text: The best debugging technique is often just explaining the problem out loud to someone else. Rubber duck debugging works because it forces you to articulate your assumptions.
Remember to update the SSL certificate before it expires on Dec 31st. Also need to renew the domain registration.

payload.selected_text: Microservices architecture provides flexibility and scalability, but introduces complexity in deployment, monitoring, and inter-service communication. Consider the trade-offs carefully before adopting.

ingredients: 1 lb large shrimp, peeled and deveined
instructions: Cook linguine according to package directions, reserve 1 cup pasta water
Heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat
Add garlic and red pepper flakes, saut√© for 30 seconds
Add shrimp, season with salt and pepper, cook 2-3 minutes per side
Pour in white wine, let simmer for 2 minutes
Add cooked pasta and toss to combine, adding pasta water as needed

payload.dream_text: I was walking through a massive library with endless floors. The books were glowing with different colors - blue for fiction, green for science, purple for philosophy. I realized I was dreaming and decided to fly up to the top floor. Once there, I found a book with my name on it that showed my entire life story, but the pages about the future were blank.

payload.note_text: Met at AI Conference 2024. Expert in reinforcement learning and robotics. Working on novel approaches to sim-to-real transfer. Very interested in our autonomous systems project. Agreed to review our paper draft and potentially collaborate on the robotics component.

payload.title: The Pragmatic Programmer
payload.creator: David Thomas & Andrew Hunt
payload.notes: Timeless advice on software craftsmanship. Key concepts: DRY principle, orthogonality, automation, and continuous learning. The tracer bullet development approach is particularly useful. Some sections feel dated but core principles remain relevant. Every developer should read this.

payload.title: Building Distributed Systems That Scale
payload.creator: Software Engineering Daily
payload.notes: Great discussion on horizontal scaling, load balancing, and database sharding. Interesting points about eventual consistency vs strong consistency trade-offs. Guest's experience with AWS autoscaling was particularly valuable.
15 minutes of focused breathing. Mind was particularly calm today. Starting the day this way really helps set a positive tone.
Missed due to early morning meeting that ran long. Will reschedule for evening.

payload.quote_text: We cannot solve our problems with the same thinking we used when we created them.
payload.author: Albert Einstein
payload.reflection: This applies so well to our current refactoring project. We keep trying to patch the old architecture, but what we really need is a fundamental rethink of the design patterns we're using.
